ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through this course, I was introduced to the fundamental theories and case studies within the field of urban design.
Further developed an understanding of theories in urbanism.
A better understanding of how spaces are designed, why they are designed as such, and how to better incorporate the human perspective into architecture and design.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The lecture material was incredibly though-provoking and insightful regarding how we should approach understanding the urban spaces around us.
A strength is a way the course is set up to focus on one city over three assignments.

The biggest strength of the course was the weekly TA sessions, which did a great job of bridging our lecture content with more contemporary examples and the group projects that we worked on throughout the semester. I also appreciated the semester-long group investigations into a city, as it helped put into perspective spaces and cities that we knew intimately within the framework of the course. The biggest weakness was that the lectures often felt as if they did not align with the assignments, and the combined graduate and undergraduate nature of the course made it so that there were many times in which readings and prerequisite knowledge for graduate students were referenced that undergrads did not know what to make sense of. That being said, the lectures themselves were very informative, entertaining, and a great learning opportunity.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This course is a great way of learning about civic architecture and the history of urban design, particularly from a lens of utilizing public space in a manner that supports the city and its inhabitants.
Yes, it was a good course with interesting readings and I loved my section.
Please stop the group grading! Some people just wont take the class seriously and then it sucks to have to get their grade!
I recommend this course for anyone interested in urban design. This was a good introductory course to take, as the title indicates.
Yes; with a relatively low workload and entertaining lectures, it is a fun course, especially as an introduction to early architecture and design.

extras.title: ARCH 345 01/URBN 345 01 - Civic Art: Intro Urban Design
